metadata.dc:author: Angel Rey, José Manuel
Benítez Cantero, José Manuel
Ayllón Terán, María Dolores

Rodríguez Perálvarez, Manuel
Poyato González, Antonio
González Galilea, Angel
Jurado García, Juan
Soto Escribano, Pilar
metadata.dc:description: Eosinophilic esophagitis is an underdiagnosed disease that should be suspected in all patients with dysphagia and food impaction. Although these are the leading symptoms, the clinical and endoscopic spectrum is highly varied. Clinicians should be aware of the risk of endoscopy-related complications in this disorder. Precautions should be maximized in endoscopic examinations to avoid iatrogenic damage. We describe the case of a young patient with esophageal stricture and dysphagia who suffered a perforation following a biopsy.
metadata.dc:title: Perforación esofágica tras biopsia en paciente con esofagitis eosinofílica.
[Esophageal perforation following a biopsy in a patient with eosinophilic esophagitis].
